parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per substance type per reported occurrence per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: SUSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: SUGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Tobacco & Alcohol use CRF page.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SUSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUTRT

datasetVariables.description: Substance name. Examples: Cigarettes, Coffee.
datasetVariables.label: Reported Name of Substance
datasetVariables.name: SUTRT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If SUTRT is modified, then the modified text is placed here.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Substance Name
datasetVariables.name: SUMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of SUTRT or SUMODIFY if the sponsor chooses to code the substance use. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Substance Name
datasetVariables.name: SUDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, or CAFFEINE.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Substance Use
datasetVariables.name: SUCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of substance use. Examples: CIGARS, CIGARETTES, BEER, WINE
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Substance Use
datasetVariables.name: SUSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUPRESP

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate whether (Y/null) information about the use of a specific substance was solicited on the CRF.
datasetVariables.label: SU Pre-Specified
datasetVariables.name: SUPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: When the use of specific substances is solicited, SUOCCUR is used to indicate whether or not (Y/N) a particular pre-specified substance was used. Values are null for substances not specifically solicited.
datasetVariables.label: SU Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: SUOCCUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSTAT

datasetVariables.description: When the use of pre-specified substances is solicited, the completion status indicates that there was no response to the question about the pre-specified substance. When there is no pre-specified list on the CRF, then the completion status indicates that substance use was not assessed for the subject.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: SUSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes the reason substance use was not collected. Used in conjunction with SUSTAT when value of SUSTAT is NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Substance Use Not Collected
datasetVariables.name: SUREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUCLAS

datasetVariables.description: Substance use class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow assumption 4.1.2.8.3 or omit SUCLAS.
datasetVariables.label: Substance Use Class
datasetVariables.name: SUCLAS

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUCLASCD

datasetVariables.description: Code corresponding to SUCLAS. May be obtained from coding.
datasetVariables.label: Substance Use Class Code
datasetVariables.name: SUCLASCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSE

datasetVariables.description: Amount of SUTRT consumed.
datasetVariables.label: Substance Use Consumption
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSE

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSTXT

datasetVariables.description: Substance use consumption amounts or a range of consumption information collected in text form.
datasetVariables.label: Substance Use Consumption Text
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSTXT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSU

datasetVariables.description: Units for SUDOSE, SUDOSTXT, and SUDOSTOT. Examples: OUNCES, CIGARETTE EQUIVALENTS, or GRAMS.
datasetVariables.label: Consumption Units
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSFRM

datasetVariables.description: Dose form for SUTRT. Examples: INJECTABLE, LIQUID, or POWDER.
datasetVariables.label: Dose Form
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSFRM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSFRQ

datasetVariables.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of SUDOSE within a specific time period. Example: Q24H (every day)
datasetVariables.label: Use Frequency Per Interval
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSFRQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDOSTOT

datasetVariables.description: Total daily use of SUTRT using the units in SUDOSU. If sponsor needs to aggregate the data over a period other than daily, then the aggregated total could be recorded in a Supplemental Qualifier variable.
datasetVariables.label: Total Daily Consumption
datasetVariables.name: SUDOSTOT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUROUTE

datasetVariables.description: Route of administration for SUTRT. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.
datasetVariables.label: Route of Administration
datasetVariables.name: SUROUTE

datasetVariables.description: Study day of end of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Substance Use
datasetVariables.name: SUENDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUDUR

datasetVariables.description: Collected duration of substance use in ISO 8601 format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariables.label: Duration of Substance Use
datasetVariables.name: SUDUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSTRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the start of the substance use relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into SUSTRF.
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: SUSTRF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUENRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the end of the substance use with relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into SUENRF.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: SUENRF

modelClassVariable.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: SUSTRTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUSTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: SUSTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Identifies the end of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUENTPT.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: SUENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SU.SUENTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: SUENTPT

description: An interventions domain that contains substance use information that may be used to assess the efficacy and/or safety of therapies that look to mitigate the effects of chronic substance use. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49615, 2018-06-29)
label: Substance Use
name: SU
